metadata.title: CVE-2017-20189 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Clojure before 1.9.0, classes can be used to construct a serializedobject that executes arbitrary code upon deserialization. This is relevantif a server deserializes untrusted objects.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-20189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clojure - 1.10.1-1
libclojure-java - 1.10.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clojure package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.1-1').
